features.featureTitle: Update the Bouquet Collection page to present a single main section titled “Bouquet Collection” containing exactly 6 product cards in a clean, premium grid layout (6 items total), each showing: product image, product name, short description, and pricing details, matching the user-provided bouquet types and copy.

Ensure bouquet card content matches the provided descriptions and pricing exactly:
- Ribbon Flower Bouquet: Description “Handmade ribbon flower bouquet with elegant wrapping.” Pricing tiers: Normal ₹89, Premium ₹119
- Artificial Flower Bouquet: Description “Long-lasting artificial flower bouquet with premium finish.” Pricing tiers: Normal ₹89, Premium ₹119
- Natural Flower Bouquet: Description “Fresh natural flower bouquet arranged beautifully.” Pricing tiers: Normal ₹89, Premium ₹119
- Pipe Cleaner Flower Bouquet: Pricing tiers: Normal ₹200, Premium ₹250, Customized Premium ₹300+ and include note: “Final price depends on customization.”
- Polaroid Bouquet: Description “Creative bouquet designed using polaroid photo memories.” Pricing: Starting from ₹350
- Customized Bouquet: Description “Fully customized bouquet designed according to theme and customer preferences.” Pricing: Starting from ₹550

Implement the Bouquet Collection grid as a responsive, equal-spacing layout with a luxury boutique feel on a soft white / beige aesthetic background. The grid must be mobile responsive and use elegant typography consistent with a premium catalog.

Add the 6 uploaded bouquet images as static frontend assets and update frontend image mappings so the Bouquet Collection cards use the assigned images in order (1st–6th) with the provided filenames: IMG_6954.jpeg, IMG_6959.jpeg, IMG_6960-5.jpeg, IMG_6958-5.jpeg, IMG_6967-5.jpeg, IMG_6966-5.jpeg.

Generate and use premium-edited versions of all 6 bouquet images that preserve original product colors/design while replacing the background with soft white or beige, adding a subtle shadow, maintaining high resolution, and centering the product. Store generated images in frontend/public/assets/generated and ensure the Bouquet Collection uses these generated images.
